channel.description: Recent content in Digital Garden 🌿 on

item.title: 3 Quick Writing Tips
item.description: 3 Quick Writing Tips I W… by @dickiebush on Twitter Metadata Author: [[@dickiebush on Twitter]] Full Title: 3 Quick Writing Tips I W… Category: #tweets URL: https://twitter.

item.title: About me
item.description: 👋 Hi, I’m Hidde! I started this digital garden because I’m an avid reader and wanted to [[notes/about the digital garden|convert this into sustainable knowledge]].

item.title: About the digital garden
item.description: Right.. what is this digital garden thing and why bother? To start with the first, there are probably as many definitions as there are digital gardens, but I like this simple take on it:

item.title: Atomic Habits - James Clear
item.description: ![[notes/images/atomic.jpg|200]] Highlights changes that seem small and unimportant at first will compound into remarkable results if you’re willing to stick with them for years.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Obsidian I recommend using Obsidian as a way to edit and grow your digital garden.

item.title: How to Take Smart Notes - Sönke Ahrens
item.description: Highlights Writing plays such a central role in learning, studying and research that it is surprising how little we think about it.

item.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People - Dale Carnegie
item.description: Highlights Only knowledge that is used sticks in your mind. By criticising, we do not make lasting changes and often incur resentment.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Now
item.description: Medical Development Manager at Novartis Pharma Enrolled in a self-development program called DNA Moving in summer 2022 Same city, bigger house/garden!

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: On Writing Well - William Zinsser
item.description: Highlights But, as always, there’s a catch. Nobody told all the new computer writers that the essence of writing is rewriting.

item.title: Planting - Piet Oudolf and Noel Kingsbury
item.description: Highlights PLANTING – THE BIG PICTURE GROUPING PLANTS The discipline needed to restrict the numbers of varieties necessary for matrix mixes to work is perhaps too tight for many locations, where a wide variety of plants are needed to engage the onlooker

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Range - David Epstein
item.description: Highlights But the game’s strategic complexity provides a lesson: the bigger the picture, the more unique the potential human contribution.

item.title: Separate writing and editing
item.description: Writing and editing are two distinct processes both requiring a very different state of mind. While writing heavily relies on creativity, exploration and in general happens in the head, while editing is a very secure and precise

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)
